data.name: Playing  with rectangles
data.description:
We start with two structures already defined and preloaded, ```Point``` and ```Rectangle```:
```rust
struct Point {
    x: f64,
    y: f64,
}

struct Rectangle {
    p1: Point,
    p2: Point,
}
```
You must implement the trait ```PartialEq``` for ```Rectangle``` (for ```Point``` is already implemented). In this kata, we assume that two rectangles are equal if their lower-left and upper-right vertices are equal (they have the same coordinates).

Then, you must implement the ```contains``` method. A rectangle contains another if its perimeter is outside the perimeter of the other.

If the two perimeters even only partially overlap, the method must return ```false```.
Hint:
-----
Changing the ```new``` method can make the solution easier.
